meanings.definition: People who work in the news industry.
meanings.sent1: The newspeople at the station are always busy.
meanings.sent2: I trust newspeople to keep me informed.
meanings.sent3: The newspeople must have eyes everywhere to know everything!
meanings.sent4: The newspeople are like modern-day storytellers, weaving tales of reality.
meanings.sent5: The newspeople shine a light on the truth for all to see.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who report on current events.
meanings.sent1: Newspeople from different networks gathered to cover the event.
meanings.sent2: The newspeople arrived early to set up their equipment.
meanings.sent3: It's like the newspeople have a secret club for breaking stories!
meanings.sent4: The newspeople are like messengers of the present, delivering news as it unfolds.
meanings.sent5: The newspeople are the eyes and ears of the public, bringing the world to our doorstep.

meanings.definition: Journalists who gather and disseminate information to the public.
meanings.sent1: The newspeople interviewed witnesses to get the full story.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the dedication of newspeople to keep us informed.
meanings.sent3: Sometimes I wonder if newspeople have a sixth sense for news!
meanings.sent4: The newspeople are like conduits of knowledge, channeling facts to the masses.
meanings.sent5: The newspeople are the bridge between events and understanding, connecting us to the world.
